sponsor.partnerMessage: EightTwenty is a solar company that focuses on creating raving fans by delivering quality energy efficiency products and services to NWA residents and businesses. With USA-made panels and 30-year warranties, you can be confident that an investment in a sustainable future will power your life for years to come. Ready to Live Solar? Learn more here.

posts.title: Art On The Bricks Art Walk This Thursday in Rogers With Special Guest
posts.content:
Downtown Rogers is attracting new and exciting events all the time and continues to be a center for creativity and collaborations in Northwest Arkansas. 

  • Defying gravity: The Art on the Bricks Art Walk theme for June is "Perpetual Motion," named after an aerial dance company performing this week in Downtown Rogers as a part of a national tour. The original concert, Y20, "quite literally elevates dance and movement in Northwest Arkansas."
  • Energy & momentum: There are four opportunities to experience Perpetual Motion Dance this week, starting today with a public aerial class at the Arkansas Arts Academy at 6p. The group will perform once tomorrow and twice during Art on the Bricks Art Walk on Thursday.

For more information about locations and times, click HERE.

posts.title: Siloam Springs Kayak Park Opens For The Season
posts.content:
Grab your paddle and boat because the Siloam Springs Kayak Park is open! 

  • On the water: The Siloam Springs Kayak Park opened in 2014 just south of the town and is located off Fisher Ford Rd on the spring-fed Illinois River. Kayaks, canoes, and tubes are all welcome to float, but you'd need to bring your own because you can't rent them at the park.
  • Go play: The park is free and open from 5:30a-11p, and the riverbank is ADA accessible. There are climbing boulders, a picnic area, accessible walking trails, and rapids engineered about 700 ft in Class I and II difficulty, so everyone can have some fun!

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Beer & Hotdogs At 'Concert Before The Concert'
posts.topic: Sponsored by First National Bank of NWA
posts.content:
First National Bank of NWA is hosting a free "concert before the concert" on June 9 in Rogers, complete with beer, hotdogs, and cornhole. 

  • Community party: The bank is celebrating its 150th birthday this year with a tailgate party at the Founders Plaza Terrace before the Jimmy Buffett concert at the AMP in Rogers. 
  • Be together: The pre-concert concert band is 412 West, a world-class rock band that brings their own groovy flavor to all the songs that make you want to sing along. There will be cool swag and everyone is welcome from 4-7p, whether attending the concert at the AMP or not. Don't forget the beer and hotdogs!

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Plant Based Chef Plans NWA Expansion
posts.content:
Recent Food Network “Big Restaurant Bet” winner has plans to expand her plan-based prepared meals business to Northwest Arkansas. 

  • Successes: The plant-based chef and owner of Little Rock-based culinary and wellness company Vito and Vera is looking for investors after winning the Cureate Courses pitch competition in Springdale earlier this year. There is no timeline for the expansion yet, but it sounds like NWA is on her horizon.
  • Wellness: The chef has 24 years of experience in home health food and is driven by the knowledge that food is medicine and can change health outcomes. The saying at Vito and Vera is feel good and taste good go hand in hand. 

Read more HERE.

posts.title: New Exhibition In Famous Hardware Co. Windows In Springdale
posts.content:
The Famous Hardware Building in Downtown Springdale has a new window display for passersby to admire. 

  • Connected: This time around, the windows have been brought to life by a sculptor and educator whose sewn inflatable sculptures use animals, plants, minerals, and the bacterial world to address human qualities and relationships.
  • Through the glass: The installation is called The Body Overwhelms and will be visible from the sidewalk infant of the building on 113 W Emma Ave through mid-August. The artist will be in Downtown Springdale on July 14 for an artist talk.

For more information, click HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Stacks: A Springdale Girl Scout Troop donated about 1,200 boxes of Girl Scout cookies to a food pantry. 
  • On the pitch: Congrats to the Har-Ber senior who posted a 5-0 record and was named Gatorade Arkansas Baseball Player of the Year!
  • Celebs: A few big names were at the Walmart Associate's Celebration this past weekend. Do you know who?
  • Shipping: Walmart has plans to build four new automated fulfillment centers and add 4,000 jobs across the country.
  • Posts: Let us know about your organization's initiative or event, and we'll see about putting it in our newsletter. Check out our advertising deals HERE.
